laboratory_examinations.findings: The spleen is enlarged measuring up to 15.1 cm with normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions. In the expected location of the appendix, there is a large amount of phlegmon and fluid spanning up to 5.7 x 6.1 cm suggestive of a contained perforated appendix.
Escherichia coli detected; value 8.8 mg/dL, which is within normal range (8.4 - 10.3 mg/dL).
